gov.sandia.rbb.impl.h2.statics
Class H2SRBB

java.lang.Object
  gov.sandia.rbb.impl.h2.statics.H2SRBB

public class H2SRBB
extends java.lang.Object

Public static functions in this class implement the SQL interface to the RBB. The create_rbb.sql script creates aliases for these so they can be called through SQL. The public functions here only accept / return datatypes for which H2 has a SQL mapping. Most functionality is placed here, with the RBB interface implementation (H2RBB) being a thin wrapper over them.

Constructor Detail

H2SRBB

public H2SRBB()
Method Detail

create

public static void create(java.sql.Connection conn,
                          java.lang.String name)
                   throws java.sql.SQLException
Runs the create_rbb.sql script on an existing database (passed in through conn). Creates the tables and aliases, and sets the human-readable name. name may be null and will be defaulted to the date/time of creation.

Parameters:
conn - Sql connection.
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException

Parameters:
conn -
Returns:
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException

schemaVersion

public static int schemaVersion()
Returns the RBB database schema version of the RBB java code. This should be incremented whenever the RBB schema changes. When an RBB is created, it is stamped with the schemaVersion of the code used to create it. When an RBB is opened, the schema version of the code must match the one stored in the RBB.

maxDouble

public static double maxDouble()
H2 doesn't seem to have a way to return the maximum double value, so make one. We really might prefer POSITIVE_INFINITY to MAX_VALUE, but POSITIVE_INFINITY comes out as the string "Infinity" in SQL which has no numeric meaning.

privateGetServerAddress

public static java.lang.String privateGetServerAddress()
                                                throws java.sql.SQLException
This is public so the H2 database engine can call it, but you should call getServerAddress instead, so you get the hostname of the server and not the client!

Throws:
java.sql.SQLException

java.sql.SQLException

isLocal

public static boolean isLocal(java.sql.Connection conn)
                       throws java.sql.SQLException
Call this to determine if the server for this connection is in the same address space as the client. Note there is intentionally no SQL binding for this - it is only called on the client side.

Throws:
java.sql.SQLException

The basic reason for this function is that H2 cannot pass a Long[] into a stored procedure.
